summary: When federal agencies find that some of their annual reports to Congress are outdated or duplicative, they can propose to eliminate or modify related reporting requirements. A 2010 law directs the Office of Management and Budget to coordinate an annual review of agencies' plans and reports. The reviews have led to new proposals and elimination of some required reports. However, OMB does not coordinate this...
title: Federal Reports: OMB and Agencies Should More Fully Implement the Process to Streamline Reporting Requirements
